messageBody:
Hi Jason,

> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of jason r tibbetts

> I assume from J.B. and Cedric's comments that test groups are
> part of TestNG, which I haven't had time to research. It's
> been enough of a headache getting our group to use what
> little infrastructure I've already put into place.

Indeed, you specify those with annotations:

@Test(groups = { "check-in", "functional", "database" })
public void testInsertion() {
// note that the method doesn't really need to start with "test"
}

As I said earlier, using marker interfaces to achieve this goal is a stopgap
measure that doesn't scale very well (and also makes your classes implement
all kinds of empty interfaces, which I personally don't find very clean, but
I'm a bit of a purist in this regard :-)).

Take a look at the TestNG documentation: even if you don't end up using
TestNG, I'm sure it will make you look at testing in novel ways that you
might reuse even in your JUnit tests...

http://beust.com/testng
